articles.title: Kang Sok Ju Meets Russian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kang Sok Ju Meets Russian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Kang Sok Ju, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him on Wednesday.

articles.title: S. Korean Trespassers Handed over to South Korean Red Cross
articles.content:
S. Korean Trespassers Handed over to South Korean Red Cross
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- A relevant institution of the DPRK intercepted south Korean man Ri Chang Ho, 58, and woman Jin So Yong, 50, who illegally entered the area of the DPRK on May 11. 
					 Their trespassing should be handled by the law of the DPRK as it is a wanton violation of the DPRK's law but the DPRK side decided to send them back from a humanitarian stand as they frankly admitted they deliberately committed the crime and earnestly requested for forgiveness.
					
					 The chairman of the Central Committee of the Red Cross Society of the DPRK sent a notice on Monday to the president of the south Korean Red Cross in which he said the repetition of the similar illegal acts by south Korean residents might entail serious consequences.
					
					 The trespassers were handed over to the south Korean Red Cross via Panmunjom on Wednesday.

articles.title: Committees for Elections of Deputies Organized in DPRK
articles.content:
Committees for Elections of Deputies Organized in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Preparations are being made across the country to successfully hold the elections of deputies to provincial (municipal), city (district) and county people's assemblies.
					 Provincial (municipal), city(district) and county election committees for the elections of deputies to the local people's assemblies were organized till June 16 according to the DPRK's Law on the Elections of Deputies to the People's Assemblies at All Levels.

articles.title: Agreement Signed between DPRK and Poland
articles.content:
Agreement Signed between DPRK and Poland
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- An agreement on the cooperation in the fields of science, education and culture between the governments of the DPRK and the Republic of Poland was signed here on Wednesday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Hwang Ho Nam, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned and from the Polish side Krzysztof Ciebien, Polish ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials.
					
					 The agreement was signed by Hwang Ho Nam and Krzysztof Ciebien.

articles.title: Taekwon-Do delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Taekwon-Do delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- A Taekwon-Do delegation headed by Leong Wai Meng, vice-president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the immortal story about the holy place of the sun, the guests looked round with keen interest the historic relics preserved with good care at the old home.
					
					 They also visited various gymnasiums at the sports village in Chongchun Street, the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum and Munsu Water Park.

articles.title: Russian Diplomats Give Helping Hand to Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Russian Diplomats Give Helping Hand to Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy did a friendship labor at the DPRK-Russia Friendship Kochang Vegetable Cooperative Farm in Chollima District on Wednesday.
					 They helped farmers in weeding fields.
					
					 They handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Celebrated
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Celebrated
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Agricultural workers and women held meetings on Wednesday in celebration of the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The meetings were separately held at the Sinam Co-op Farm in Ryongchon County, North Phyongan Province and at the Hall of Women in Pyongyang.
					
					 Reporters and speakers praised Kim Jong Il for performing undying exploits for the times, revolution, country and its people by leading the WPK to victory with his extraordinary ideo-theoretical wisdom, outstanding leadership and noble popular traits.
					
					 He formulated Songun politics as the party's mode of leading revolution and developed the WPK into the militant staff of the Songun revolution in the days of ordeals, they said.
					
					 They recalled that he developed the WPK into the party of the leader which fully established the system of the monolithic idea and leadership, the invincible party enjoying the absolute support and trust from the popular masses and the powerful force leading the Songun revolution.
					
					 They renewed their determination to give steady continuity to the long journeys for revolution generation after generation along the path covered by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, having loyalty for Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: ITF Vice-President Gives Impressions of DPRK Visit
articles.content:
ITF Vice-President Gives Impressions of DPRK Visit
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- A Taekwon-Do delegation, involving the vice-president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation (ITF), the chairman of the European Taekwon-Do Federation and other renowned personages, visited Pyongyang to attend a memorial service for Choe Hong Hui, ex-president of the ITF on his 13th death anniversary.
					 The delegation was touched by the fact that Taekwon-Do has been widely disseminated in the DPRK, its cradle, under the deep care of the Workers' Party of Korea and the government.
					
					 Referring to the memorial service, Leong Wai Meng, vice-president of the ITF, told KCNA that the service was very emotional for his colleagues and he could see many of his colleagues fighting back their tears.
					
					 Their stay here is for recharging their battery and to remind them of Choe Hong Hui's teachings and ideals and also the goal of Taekwon-Do, the vice-president said.
					
					 Saying that the newly-built Taekwon-Do Holy Center in Pyongyang is a wonderful edifice, he said:
					
					 We are very thankful to the DPRK government and especially your great leaders, and your dear leader now for having put so much attention and so much contribution towards our development.
					
					 On behalf of all my colleagues, we thank your country's leaders and also your government for all the help you have given and for your attention.

articles.title: DPRK Wins in World Cup Asian Qualifier Match with Uzbekistan
articles.content:
DPRK Wins in World Cup Asian Qualifier Match with Uzbekistan
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The DPRK football team beat its Uzbek rival 4:2 in a second-round Asian qualifier for the 2018 FIFA World Cup at Kim Il Sung Stadium here on Tuesday.
					 The stadium was crowded with tens of thousands of citizens.
					
					 In the match Pak Kwang Ryong of the DPRK scored the first goal for the team in four minutes. Other scores were made by Jang Kuk Chol in 16 minutes, Ro Hak Su in 34 minutes and Ri Hyok Chol in 36 minutes.
					
					 The Uzbek team scored two goals in 52 and 79 minutes.
					
					 Earlier on June 11, the DPRK team won a match with its Yemeni rival 1:0. After all it has secured six points with two wins in two matches at present.
					
					 After the match, Kasimov Mirjalal, chief coach of the Uzbek team, told reporters that it was a very fierce competition and that the DPRK team has good abilities and its footballers are well prepared physically.
					
					 Kim Chang Bok, chief coach of the DPRK team, said that the victory was attributable to the application of the guerrilla-style offensive tactics taught by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Spectators' enthusiastic cheering also encouraged our footballers and coaches greatly, he said, expressing the will to live up to the citizens' expectation with better results.

articles.title: Triplets Born in Pyongyang Maternity Hospital
articles.content:
Triplets Born in Pyongyang Maternity Hospital
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The 453rd triplets were born in the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital of the DPRK.
					 Jo Kum Il living in Kim Hyong Gwon County, Ryanggang Province had three daughters at a birth on May 5.
					
					 Before this, Kim Kum Ok living in Sunan District, Pyongyang gave easy birth to three sons on May 4, Ri Un Byol living in Pujon County, South Hamgyong Province three sons on May 1 and Kang Hyang Ok living in Musan County, North Hamgyong Province three sons on April 27 in the hospital.
					
					 Ri Yun Suk, a doctor of the hospital, said it has been unprecedented that triplets were born one after another in less than 10 days.
					
					 Now those triplets are incubated under the deep attention of medical workers, she said.
					
					 Jo Kum Il, mother of the 453rd triplets, said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in their lifetime sent even helicopters for the safe birth of triplets and took a measure to give silver knives and gold rings as gifts to triplets and their parents, saying that the birth of triplets augurs the prosperity of the country.
					
					 Keeping deep in my mind the loving care shown by the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu, I will bring up my triplets to be faithful to the leadership of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Project for Scientists Street Progresses Apace in DPRK
articles.content:
Project for Scientists Street Progresses Apace in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The second-phase project for construction of Mirae Scientists Street on the bank of the River Taedong is now progressing apace in Pyongyang under the deep care of the Workers' Party of Korea and the government.
					 The street is to be arranged with skyscraping and towering apartment houses, public buildings, modern service facilities and parks and other cultural and welfare establishments.
					
					 Servicepersons and civilians involved in the project have sped up the construction of apartment houses and various buildings on a full scale, changing the environment of the project with each passing day.
					
					 At present soldier-builders work such miracle as raising one floor of apartment houses a day.
					
					 Other builders, too, carry out their daily assignments smoothly through introduction of advanced building methods. 
					
					 The Ministry of Railways, the Ministry of Physical Culture and Sports and other units are stepping their undertakings for the project, including the construction of schools, hospital and service establishments, in an aim to finish them ahead of schedule.

articles.title: Korean People Still Remember Kim Ung U, Ardent Patriot
articles.content:
Korean People Still Remember Kim Ung U, Ardent Patriot
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Today marks the birth anniversary of Kim Ung U (June 17, 1848 - October 4, 1878), great-grandfather of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On this day, people in the DPRK are recalling with deep emotion his patriotic life.
					
					 Kim Ung U took the lead in the struggle to sink the U.S. imperialist aggressors' warship General Sherman when it intruded into the River Taedong in Pyongyang in August 1866.
					
					 The aggressors aboard the ship sailed up to Yanggak Islet along the River Taedong, killing inhabitants at random with cannons and guns and despoiling of their properties. Their intrusion was aimed to rob an ancestral royal mausoleum and pave a way for aggression on Korea by force of arms.
					
					 Enraged at their outrageous atrocity, Kim Ung U aroused the inhabitants in and around Mangyongdae to the struggle against the aggressors.
					
					 Under his guidance, the people in the walled city of Pyongyang sank the warship through a fire attack, displaying the stamina and will of the Korean nation not to forgive any foreign aggressors.
					
					 Han Myong Sok, a Pyongyang citizen, told KCNA that the flames of anti-U.S. struggle kindled by Kim Ung U at that time are now flaring up on this land more vigorously.
					
					 If the U.S dares to make a preemptive attack on this land, we will certainly settle accounts with it by dint of the might of Songun (military-first), he said.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Authors Lot of Works on Ideological Work
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Authors Lot of Works on Ideological Work
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- June 19 marks the 20th anniversary of the publication of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential for Accomplishing Socialism". 
					 On this occasion the service personnel and people of the DPRK look back upon the ideological and theoretical feats he performed by authoring  the work for the prosperity of the country and clearly indicating the road of building a thriving nation.
					
					 In his many works he lucidly clarified that the Juche idea, Songun idea serves as an ever-victorious militant banner for defending socialism.
					
					 "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" and other works deal with the idea of modeling all the service personnel and people on the idea of the great leader and steadfastly keeping to road of Juche, Songun. 
					
					 "Songun Politics of Our Party Is an Effective Socialist Political Mode", "On Learning from the Revolutionary Soldier Spirit" and other works serve as ideological and mental pabulum for the service personnel and people to weather obstacles and difficulties and an engine for bringing about miracles and innovations in the era of Songun.
					
					  There is also a work clearly indicating tasks and ways for strengthening the socialist education in every way.
					
					 His works are monumental works which make the militant spirit and revolutionary optimism prevail across the country with life culture and soldiers' culture created by the Korean People's Army as a model. 
					
					 His works also deal with the principled issues arising in strengthening the education through the political and ideological education centers and 
					
					underline the need to make the media of the Workers' Party of Korea beat their drums more loudly for creation and innovations in work sites through information and agitation campaign.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams U.S. Projected Ground Test on Super Energy Laser
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams U.S. Projected Ground Test on Super Energy Laser
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- According to foreign press reports, the U.S. air force will conduct a ground test on super energy laser as part of estimation of air-launched laser weapon at the White Sands Missile Testing Ground from the end of this year. 
					 Minju Joson Wednesday in a commentary says this is a revelation of a reckless military action to carry out the Asia-Pacific rebalancing strategy and, furthermore, dominate the world.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					  The said-action goes to clearly prove that the U.S. is the wrecker of peace and enemy of human beings who did not hesitate to bring mankind into the disaster of a nuclear war in a bid to realize its ambition to dominate the world.
					
					 Peace is the desire common to mankind and no one will allow the U.S. to plunge mankind into the disaster of a nuclear war.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the U.S. justify its criminal scenario to escalate a nuclear war into space by using WMDs and other weaponry.
					
					 The U.S. moves to develop latest weapons including the development of laser weapons are bound to go bust just as its reckless "star wars" plan was thrown into the dust-bin of history.
					
					 The U.S. should cool down its head heated with the wild ambition to dominate the world and stop at once the policy of military confrontation to lead to a final destruction, mindful of the serious consequences to be entailed by its anachronistic military actions.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Policy of Dependence on U.S. under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Policy of Dependence on U.S. under Fire
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article lashes out the south Korean authorities' sycophancy and servility to the U.S.
					 Of late, the U.S. is openly pressurizing the south Korean authorities to take a positive approach towards the dispute in the South Sea of China, siding with it, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 This arrogant attitude of the U.S. disregarding even elementary diplomatic practice is something that can be found only in the unequal U.S.-south Korean relations.
					
					 It is quite natural that the present south Korean ruling quarters, colonial lackeys and puppet forces of the U.S., are not in a position to utter even a word of protest against its demand.
					
					 South Korea is turning into mayhem as the days go by due to the ever-festering scramble among big powers for hegemony. This is its disgraceful reality. 
					
					 This is a sealed fate of the south Korean ruling forces that are prolonging their remaining days by dint of sycophancy and dependence on outsiders, having neither proper political philosophy nor sovereignty.
					
					 The U.S. shameless behavior over the issue of the South Sea of China and the south Korean authorities' foolish act of blindly following the U.S. clearly prove that the U.S. and south Korea are arch criminals and provocateurs escalating the tension on the Korean peninsula and in the region.
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to break with their disgraceful past torn with sycophancy and servility, though belatedly, if they have an ounce of reason and self-respect.

articles.title: South Korean Authorities' Attempt to Compromise with Japan over Sexual Slavery under Fire
articles.content:
South Korean Authorities' Attempt to Compromise with Japan over Sexual Slavery under Fire
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore on June 14 carried an editorial accusing the authorities of attempting to comprise with Japan over the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 The present chief executive hinted at this, talking about "considerable progress" when interviewed by the Washington Post on June 11, the paper noted, and went on:
					
					 Her remarks drew attention as they were made under the pressure of the U.S. for improving relations with Japan.
					
					 The victims of the sexual slavery die one after another and the above-said issue should be resolved when they are alive.
					
					 What is important in the settlement of the above-said issue is for the Japanese government to admit its responsibility. 
					
					 The "government" should bear in mind that seeking a political compromise in disregard of this principle is little short of reneging on its original objective.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Calls for Remaining True to June 15 Joint Declaration
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Calls for Remaining True to June 15 Joint Declaration
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People in an editorial on June 15 said that the June 15 joint declaration is an invariable milestone for national reunification. 
					 It went on:
					
					 15 years have passed since the publication of the June 15 joint declaration. Thanks to the historic event, there were brisk cooperation and exchange between the south and the north and the reunification movement could reach a new stage.
					
					 However, the June 15 joint declaration is totally denied in south Korea. 
					
					 The present regime has pursued a military alliance against the north, joining hands with the U.S. and Japan quite contrary to the basic spirit of the joint declaration.
					
					 It called upon organizations of the reunification movement to exert all efforts to mark the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself.

articles.title: Anti-U.S. Actions Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. Actions Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy in south Korea held anti-U.S. actions in Seoul on June 13.
					 Holding placards, they condemned the U.S. for introducing dangerous anthrax germs and attempting a germ warfare against the north, in utter disregard of the lives of the south Koreans.
					
					 The demonstrators scattered leaflets. As they attempted to advance to the U.S. embassy, the police stopped them and walked all of them off.
					
					 The organization issued a statement in protest against the security authorities' action.
					
					 As long as the U.S. forces are present in south Korea, the north-targeted war drills and attempt at a germ warfare to exterminate the Korean nation will go on and cases similar to the murder of Hyo Sun and Mi Son will occur again, it warned.

articles.title: Anti-U.S. Actions in South Korea
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. Actions in South Korea
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The People's Action for Peace against War in south Korea held a rally for independence and peace in Seoul on June 14.
					 The speakers assailed the U.S. test of germ weapons and scheme to deploy THAAD.
					
					 They disclosed that the U.S. introduced active anthrax germs into the Osan U.S. air force base and conducted even the botlinus germ experiment.
					
					 They insisted that the U.S. chief executive and the commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea should make apologies for the grave situation.
					
					 They demanded the U.S. give assurances against the recurrence of the above-said crime. 
					
					 They called for turning out in an all-people march, loudly chanting anti-U.S. slogans.
					
					 The ralliers held a demo.
					
					 When the police blocked their demo, they didn't give up their struggle, demanding the U.S. forces commander come out to take a letter of protest.
					
					 Enraged by the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces' arrogant attitude, the demonstrators staged a sit-in strike.

articles.title: South Korean Paper Assails Authorities' Actions against Reunification
articles.content:
South Korean Paper Assails Authorities' Actions against Reunification
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hankuk Ilbo on June 9 carried an article accusing the authorities of their acts against reunification.
					 The paper ridiculed that the present regime is talkative about "confidence-building process" and "gaining a great opportunity of unification" but it behaves quite contrary to its utterances.
					
					 The paper went on:
					
					 When the north proposed dialogue, the regime missed the chance while complaining about its level. When the regime proposed the dialogue, it busied itself with diverting elsewhere the climate for it.
					
					 The "golden chance" of implementing the principle governing the ties between the south and the north in a "friendly and amicable manner" was regretfully missed due to the irresponsible demeanors and incompetence on the part of the authorities.

articles.title: Chongryon Supports DPRK Government's Statement
articles.content:
Chongryon Supports DPRK Government's Statement
 Tokyo, June 16 (KNS-KCNA) -- The Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) issued a statement on June 16 in support of the statement of the DPRK government.
					 The statement released by the DPRK government on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration marked an epochal occasion in improving the north-south relations and opening a turning phase of national reconciliation and unity true to the noble will of Marshal Kim Jong Un for reunification, the statement said.
					
					 Prompted by the aspiration and desire of the whole nation for independent reunification, peace and prosperity, leader Kim Jong Il provided another north-south summit in October, 2007 when epochal events, something unprecedented in the north-south relations, were taking place in line with the trend of the June 15 era of reunification, and made sure that the October 4 declaration, the programme for implementing the June 15 joint declaration, was adopted and published, opening a bright prospect for the inter-Korean relations and the way of national reunification, it noted.
					
					 Chongryon will make every possible effort to make Koreans in Japan, who lived under the Japanese imperialist colonial rule and have suffered the pain resulting from the national division, regardless of the south Korean Residents Association in Japan, independent organizations and Japanese nationality, this significant year marking the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation, join in the drive for achieving reconciliation and unity of the Korean community in Japan and reunifying the country independently, the statement stressed.

articles.title: Koreans Organization in China Calls for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Koreans Organization in China Calls for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement on June 16 on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 The statement said that it is a fundamental principle and way of Korea's reunification to carve out the destiny of the nation and pave the road of the reunification independently by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation. 
					
					 The eye-opening events that took place in the course of implementing the declaration proved that it is possible to achieve independent reunification and peace and prosperity when all compatriots at home and abroad attain great national unity in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself, it noted, 
					
					 The association will take the lead in the struggle for defending the independence and peace of the country against the nation-splitting forces, sycophantic and treacherous forces and the U.S. and Japanese aggressor forces under the uplifted banner of the June 15 joint declaration, it declared.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Call for Ending National Split and Reunifying Country
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Call for Ending National Split and Reunifying Country
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the U.S. on June 15 issued a joint statement calling for ending national division and waging actions for Korea's reunification.
					 South Korea was reduced to a colony of the U.S. and an obstacle is lying in the way of reunification due to the moves of the U.S. and the Japanese imperialists, the statement said, adding:.
					
					 All the Koreans have struggled for reunification under the uplifted banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The June 15 joint national event has been barred from taking place since the emergence of the present regime.
					
					 The south Korean chief executive must step down, instead of standing in the way of reunification of Korea.
					
					 The statement called on reunification movement organizations of Korean community in the U.S. to take an active part in the actions for ending the 70 year-long presence of the U.S. forces in south Korea and to make efforts for peaceful reunification.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Call for Achieving National Reunification by Concerted Efforts
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Call for Achieving National Reunification by Concerted Efforts
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification released a statement on June 15 to mark the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 The south Korean conservative regime has denied the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and faked up false cases for confrontation including the Cheonan warship sinking case in a bid to stifle the DPRK, the statement said.
					
					 The DPRK is pursuing the Songun politics to defend itself and reunify the country, it said, adding that the south Korean regime should clearly know that the nukes of the DPRK are the shield for preventing a war.
					
					 The statement called for reunifying the country by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation, the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: Koreans in Russia Celebrate Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Koreans in Russia Celebrate Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Russia held a meeting in Moscow on June 14 in celebration of the 15th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 Present there Chairman of the confederation Kim Chil Song, representatives of overseas compatriots organizations, Koreans in Russia, members of the Russia-DPRK Friendship Association and experts on Korean affairs.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to Russia and his embassy members.
					
					 The DPRK ambassador made a congratulatory address to be followed by speeches.
					
					 They referred to the historical background against which the June 15 joint declaration was adopted, its contents and successes made in its implementation.
					
					 They held that the joint declaration should be preserved and implemented without fail as its validity has been proved in practice.
					
					 They enjoyed an art performance given by Koreans in Russia and Russians.

articles.title: Koreans in Russia Mark Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Koreans in Russia Mark Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- An event to mark the 15th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration took place at the DPRK consulate-general in Nakhodka on Monday.
					 Displayed at the venue of the event were photos showing the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill.
					
					 Also on show were works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu, books dealing with their great personality and photos showing the development of the DPRK.
					
					 The participants placed a floral basket and bouquets before the portraits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il standing together atop Mt. Paektu and paid tribute to them.
					
					 At the lecture the speakers said that Kim Jong Il provided the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, adding this exploit would always be remembered by the Koreans.
					
					 They vowed to take the lead in the action for the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea as clarified in the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 At the end of the lecture the participants watched Korean film "My Country Emerges Victorious by Dint of Single-Minded Unity".
					
					 Then they went round a photo and book exhibition hall.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Observed in Cuba, Peru
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Observed in Cuba, Peru
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Round-table talks, book and photo exhibitions and film shows were held at the DPRK embassies in Havana and Lima on June 5 and 10 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos dealing with the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, and books and photos introducing the DPRK. 
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "The Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum" and "Masikryong Ski Resort".
					
					 Present there on invitation were representatives of foreign political parties, organizations and institutions residing in Cuba and personages of various circles of Peru. Also attending the events were DPRK ambassadors to those countries and staff members of their embassies.
					
					 The representative of the Communist Party of Chile in Cuba at the round-table talks said it is the greatest exploit of Kim Jong Il that he defended the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK and socialism in the closing years of the last century when socialism suffered a setback in the East European countries and the imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK were getting more vicious.
					
					 The general secretary of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru said at the exhibition that Kim Jong Il's works are precious textbooks which should be regarded as guidelines in party building and activities.
					
					 After watching a Korean film, the international secretary of the Communist Party of Peru "Red Motherland" stressed that all successes registered by the Korean people in the revolution and construction are the brilliant fruition of the idea of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on building the Juche-type party and their exploits.

articles.title: Kuwaiti Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification Inaugurated
articles.content:
Kuwaiti Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification Inaugurated
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The Kuwaiti Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification was inaugurated in Kuwait City on June 4.
					 Read out at the inaugural ceremony was the appeal "Let's more dynamically conduct international solidarity movement for supporting Korea's independent and peaceful reunification" made by the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea.
					
					 Javid Ahmad, chairman of the Kuwait Asian Journalist Association who doubles as director of the administrative department of the Kuwait Times Publishing House, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it, the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and other just reunification proposals made by the DPRK conduct activities for supporting peace and reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Poland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Poland
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "On Having a Correct Understanding of Nationalism" was brought out in booklet by the Torun Publishing House in Poland on June 10.
					 The work, published in February Juche 91 (2002), deals with the birth and essence of nationalism and the past view on it and important issues arising in achieving independent development of the nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Studied in Bulgaria, Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Studied in Bulgaria, Nigeria
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- A seminar and a briefing on works of supreme leader Kim Jong Un took place in Bulgaria and Nigeria on June 9 and 10.
					  The followers of the Juche idea of the Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism said that Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" reflects his firm faith and will to build a thriving nation by thoroughly embodying the noble examples of patriotism possessed by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Employees of a Nigerian company at a briefing on Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" praised him for successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of the great leaders without an inch of deflection and continuously developing the Workers' Party of Korea into the party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: DPRK Important Day Observed by British Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK Important Day Observed by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on June 10 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The statement said that Kim Jong Il started his work at the C.C., WPK on June 19, 1964 and successfully carried forward and developed the cause of building the Juche-type party started by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, the WPK never allowed infiltration of any residue of outdated ideas like revisionism and opportunism but firmly maintained revolutionary principle of the party despite worldwide political upheavals such as the collapse of socialism in the closing years of the last century, the statement noted.
					
					 A lot of revolutionaries and progressives in the world were given fresh faith in socialism and courage and the DPRK became to shine brightly as the beacon of hope thanks to him, it said, and went on:
					
					 His immortal exploits are more brightly shining by Marshal Kim Jong Un who is leading the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 We appeal to all the followers of the Juche idea and Songun idea across the world to significantly celebrate June 19, the most important day in the strengthening and developing of the WPK, when Kim Jong Il started his work at the C.C., WPK.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Peru
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Peru
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- A Peruvian preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the liberation of Korea was formed in Lima on June 10.
					 Tani Baler Lopera, international secretary of the Communist Party of Peru "Red Motherland", was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events such as national meeting, lecture and seminar on the occasion of the significant holidays of Korea.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Kuwait
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Kuwait
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- A Kuwaiti preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the liberation of Korea was formed in Kuwait City on June 4.
					 Javid Ahmad, chairman of the Asian Journalist Association and director of the administrative department of the Kuwait Times Publishing House, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to publish works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and organize diverse political and cultural events including meeting and film show from June to October.

articles.title: Foreign Figures Support Korean People's Cause of Reunification
articles.content:
Foreign Figures Support Korean People's Cause of Reunification
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Personages of Indonesia and Syria released statements on June 10 on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 Ristiyanto, general secretary of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, said:
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration is the most just programme for reunification and a milestone that makes it possible for the Korean nation to achieve the reunification of the country, its long-cherished desire, by its own efforts in the idea of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 Thanks to the adoption of the declaration, the Korean nation dynamically advanced along the road of reconciliation, cooperation and reunification with fresh hope and confidence in national reunification.
					
					 However, the north-south relations have deteriorated to an extreme phase and a stumbling block has lain in the way for implementing the joint declaration since pro-U.S. conservative forces took power in south Korea.
					
					 We vehemently denounce in the name of the world peace- and justice-loving progressive people the south Korean regime's moves to escalate confrontation with the compatriots in the north and ignite a war against it.
					
					 Saber Ballul, department head of the Political Faculty of University of Damascus, said the world progressive people are convinced that the friendly Korean people would resolutely foil the anti-reunification moves of the U.S. and the south Korean regime and reunify the country without fail.

articles.title: Russian Friendship Organization Expresses Full Support to DPRK's Efforts for Improving Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Russian Friendship Organization Expresses Full Support to DPRK's Efforts for Improving Inter-Korean Relations
 Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK issued a statement on June 10 on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the month of solidarity for supporting the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea. 
					 The statement expressed full support to an appeal of the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea to conduct a dynamic international solidarity movement in support of the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 From June to October this year mark the period of solidarity with the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea. 
					
					 June 15 marks the 15th anniversary of the publication of the north-south joint declaration and October will observe the 35th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo (DFRK).
					
					 President Kim Il Sung set forth the proposal for founding the DFRK 35 years ago.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il provided the north-south summit in Pyongyang in June, 2000, the first of its kind in history and made sure that a joint declaration was adopted. 
					
					 We have fully supported the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, the milestone of Korea's reunification.
					
					 Regretfully, the U.S. and its followers have persistently disregarded the DPRK's consistent efforts to achieve the country's reunification in a peaceful way through the great unity of the Korean nation free from foreign interference.
					
					 All this is the moves to spark a large-scale international dispute which may ignite a nuclear war.
					
					 We extend full support to the DPRK's efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: Entregados intrusos ilegales a la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Entregados intrusos ilegales a la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 17 de junio (ACNC) -- Un organo concerniente de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea detuvo el pasado dia 11 de mayo a los habitantes surcoreanos Ri Chang Ho (m, 58 anos de edad) y Jin So Yong (f, 50 anos de edad), quienes entraron ilegalmente en la region de nuestra parte.
					Los actos cometidos por los detenidos debian ser arreglados por la ley de la RPDC porque constituyen una violacion flagrante a la ley de ella. Pero la RPDC decidio devolverlos desde el punto de vista humanitario ya que los detenidos reconocieron francamente sus crimenes cometidos intencionalmente y pidieron perdon con ansiedad.
					
					El presidente del Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la RPDC  remitio el dia 15 una nota de aviso a su par de la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea de que causaran serias consecuencias en caso de ocurrir otra vez en el futuro tales actos ilegales entre los habitantes surcoreanos.
					
					Los intrusos fueron entregados el dia 17 a la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea por via de Phanmunjom.

articles.title: Constituidos comites electorales a todos niveles para elecciones de diputados
articles.content:
Constituidos comites electorales a todos niveles para elecciones de diputados
Pyongyang, 17 de junio (ACNC) -- Se desarrollan en escala nacional los preparativos para asegurar con exito las elecciones de diputados a las asambleas populares de las provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (los municipios) y los distritos.
					En virtud de la ley de elecciones de diputados a las asambleas populares a todos los niveles de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, fueron constituidos hasta el dia 16 los comites electorales de las provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (los municipios) y los distritos para las elecciones de diputados a las asambleas populares locales y se ponen en funcionamiento.

articles.title: Rubricado convenio sobre cooperacion en ciencia, educacion y cultura entre gobiernos de RPDC y Polonia
articles.content:
Rubricado convenio sobre cooperacion en ciencia, educacion y cultura entre gobiernos de RPDC y Polonia 
Pyongyang, 17 de junio (ACNC) -- Quedo rubricado este miercoles en esta capital el convenio sobre la cooperacion en la ciencia, la educacion y la cultura entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica de Polonia.
					En la ceremonia de firmas participaron por la parte coreana el vicepresidente del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Hwang Ho Nam y otros funcionarios, y por la polaca, el embajador Krzysztof Ciebien y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica en Corea. 
					
					Hwang Ho Nam y Krzysztof Ciebien firmaron el documento.

articles.title: Equipo coreano vence a su rival de Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Equipo coreano vence a su rival de Uzbekistan
Pyongyang, 17 de junio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 16 en el Estadio Kim Il Sung el primer partido entre el equipo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el de Uzbekistan integrados al grupo H de la segunda etapa de las eliminatorias de la region asiatica para ganar el boleto a la Copa Mundial de la FIFA 2018.
					El equipo coreano vencio a su rival por 4:2.
					
					Con anterioridad, el once coreano marco 1 a 0 en la primera competencia con su rival del Yemen, efectuado en Qatar.
